conclusion: Analyzing how liquid flows from containers A, B, C to D or E through baffles.
Board has colored rectangular baffles, top containers A (blue), B (yellow), C (pink), bottom containers D and E (blue).
Second and third images show liquid flowing down.
Blue liquid from A flows downward, hits black diagonal baffle, flows along it to the bottom, then hits yellow horizontal baffle.
Blue liquid accumulates near the left side in the third image.
Yellow liquid from B flows downward, hits black diagonal baffle, flows along it to the bottom, then encounters yellow horizontal baffle.
Yellow liquid mixes with blue and collects toward the left side.
Pink liquid from C flows straight down, appears to flow toward the right side across gray horizontal baffle.
D is positioned on the left side, E is to the right of D.
Blue (A) and yellow (B) liquids converge on the left side where D is located, pink (C) liquid flows to the right side where E is located.
Liquids from A (blue) and B (yellow) will flow into container D, while liquid from C (pink) will flow into container E.
